segments.text: Oh my goodness, the water is everywhere!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see it pouring over the sink, creating a huge puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the woman is just standing there, drying a plate, like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be in some kind of trance, not noticing the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the children in the background, trying to get cookies, and it's just adding to the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long this has been going on, with the water overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit surprised that no one has done anything about it yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the stool the boy is standing on looks really unstable, and it's making me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this whole scene is just a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the garden outside, so calm and tidy, and it's such a contrast to the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I'm watching a slow-motion accident, and it's making me really anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR
